trans-unit.source: Represents a control that allows the user to select a single item from a drop-down list.

In this topic: - [Introduction](#Introduction) - [Accessibility](#Accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#DeclarativeSyntax) ## Introduction Use the DropDownList control to create a single-selection drop-down list control.

You can control the appearance of the DropDownList control by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList.BorderColor%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList.BorderStyle%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList.BorderWidth%2A> properties.

To specify the items that you want to appear in the DropDownList control, place a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object for each entry between the opening and closing tags of the DropDownList control.
The DropDownList control also supports data binding.
To bind the control to a data source, create a data source, such as a <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> object, that contains the items to display in the control.
Then, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBind%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to bind the data source to the DropDownList control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList.SelectedIndex%2A> property to programmatically determine the index of the item selected by the user from the DropDownList control.
The index can then be used to retrieve the selected item from the `Items` collection of the control.

## Accessibility For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Declarative Syntax ```              ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> class.
Adds HTML attributes and styles that need to be rendered to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.
This member is used primarily by control developers when deriving a custom control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> class.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream that renders HTML contents to the client.
Gets or sets the border color of the control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the border color of the control.
Gets or sets the border style of the control.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the border width for the control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> that represents the border width for the control.
Creates a collection to store child controls.
Always returns an <xref href="System.Web.UI.EmptyControlCollection"></xref>.
Processes postback data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList"></xref> control.

The ASP.NET page framework tracks all the server controls that return `true` from this method call, and then invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control.
The index within the posted collection that references the content to load.
The collection of all incoming name values posted to the server.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList"></xref> control's state changes as a result of the postback event; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Raises events for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList"></xref> control when postback occurs.

The ASP.NET page framework calls the RaisePostDataChangedEvent method on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList.LoadPostData%2A> method indicates that the state of the list items has changed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control.

The RaisePostDataChangedEvent method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event.
Control developers can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to perform custom processing when the user selects items in the control.
Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList"></xref> control.
Use the SelectedIndex property to programmatically specify or determine the index of the selected item from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control.
An item is always selected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control.
You cannot clear the selection from every item in the list at the same time.
> [!NOTE] > The indexes for the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control are zero-based.
The index of the selected item in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList"></xref> control.
The default value is 0, which selects the first item in the list.

Gets a value that indicates whether the control should set the <xref uid="langword_csharp_disabled" name="disabled" href=""></xref> attribute of the rendered HTML element to "disabled" when the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.IsEnabled*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This property indicates how ASP.NET should render HTML for a control when the control is disabled.
If this property is `true`, ASP.NET renders a `disabled` attribute when a control is disabled.
If this property is `false`, ASP.NET renders a `class` attribute when a control is disabled.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.SupportsDisabledAttribute%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderingCompatibility%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property indicates an ASP.NET version lower than `4.0`; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Processes posted data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList"></xref> control.
The key value used to index an entry in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> that contains post information.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the posted content is different from the last posting; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Raises events for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList"></xref> control on postback.
Always throws an <xref href="System.Web.HttpException"></xref> exception because multiple selection is not supported for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control does not support multiple selections and throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception.
In all cases.
